ARABIC: بَلْ كَذَّبُوا۟ بِٱلْحَقِّ لَمَّا جَآءَهُمْ فَهُمْ فِىٓ أَمْرٍ مَّرِيجٍ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: But they denied the truth when it came to them. They are, therefore, in a very muddled state.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: But no! They called the truth a lie when it came to them; so they are in a confused state.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: They gave the lie to the Truth when it came to them. So they are now in a state of great perplexity.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: In fact, they have rejected the truth that has come to them, thus, they live in confusion.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: In fact they denied the Truth when it came to them, so they are now in a dilemma.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Nay, but they have denied the truth when it has come to them, so they are in a Marij state.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Nay, they rejected the truth when it came to them, so they are (now) in a state of confusion.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: Nay, but they cried lies to the truth when it came to them, and so they are in a case confused.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Nay, but they have denied the truth when it came unto them, therefor they are now in troubled case.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: But they denied the truth when it came to them, so they are in a state of confusion.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: Aye! they belie the truth when it cometh Unto them; wherefore they are in an affair confused.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Indeed, they denied the truth when it came to them; so they are now in a perplexed state of affairs.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: But they deny the Truth when it comes to them: so they are in a confused state.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Nay, but they have denied the truth (this Quran) when it has come to them, so they are in a confused state (can not differentiate between right and wrong).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Rather, they belied the truth when it came to them, and now they are in a state of confusion.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: But they denied the truth when it has come to them, so they are in a confused state.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: But they denied the truth when it came to them, so they are in a confused condition.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [50:5] Nay, but they denied the truth, the Qur’ān, when it came to them and so they, with regard to the Prophet (s) and the Qur’ān, are [now] in a confounded situation, a troubled [one]. [For] on one occasion they said [that he was], ‘A sorcerer!’ [cf. Q. 38:4] and [that his statements were] ‘[Nothing but manifest] sorcery!’ [cf. Q. 37:15], on another, ‘A poet!’ [cf. Q. 21:5] and ‘Poetry!’ [cf. Q. 36:69], and still on another, ‘A soothsayer!’ [cf. Q. 52:29] and [that his statements were nothing more than] soothsaying [cf. Q. 69:42].
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Nay, but they) the Quraysh (have denied the Truth) Muhammad (pbuh) and the Qur'an (when it came unto them) this is the second clause of the oath, i.e. by the noble and glorious Qur'an, Muhammad (pbuh) has brought them the Qur'an, (therefore they are now in troubled case) they are in error; it is also said that this means: they are confused; and it is also said this means: they are in disagreement, some of them believe while others do not.
